alert.note: Alert for Haleakala Summit (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued March 07 at 3:37PM HST until March 09 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR ALL HAWAIIAN ISLANDS FROM 12 AM HST WEDNESDAY THROUGH 12 AM HST THURSDAY... ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FOR THE BIG ISLAND SUMMITS THROUGH 6 PM HST SUNDAY... ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FOR THE HALEAKALA SUMMIT FROM 6 PM HST THIS EVENING THROUGH 6 AM HST THURSDAY... .A strong cold front nearing Kauai this evening will sweep from west to east through the islands overnight tonight through Wednesday night. Strong and gusty winds will begin after midnight tonight and continue through 12 AM Thursday across the lower elevations all islands. Strong winds will also affect the higher elevations on the Big Island and Haleakala. The winds will be particularly strong and long lasting over the Big Island. The winds are not expected to be as strong or last as long over the Haleakala summit. ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 AM HST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Southwest winds 55 to 65 mph with higher gusts. * WHERE...Haleakala Summit. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to 6 AM HST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Winds this strong can make driving and walking dangerous. The winds can forcefully open doors and damage hinges or slam doors shut, possibly causing injuries.
info.instruction: Be prepared for road-closures. Postpone travel to the summits until conditions improve.
